article:
A 'test score' is a piece of information, usually a number, that conveys the
performance of an examinee on a test. One formal definition is that it is "a
summary of the evidence contained in an examinee's responses to the items of a
test that are related to the construct or constructs being
measured." Thissen, D., & Wainer, H. (2001). Test Scoring. Mahwah, NJ:
Erlbaum. Page 1, sentence 1.

Test scores are interpreted with a norm-referenced or criterion-referenced
interpretation, or occasionally both. A norm-referenced interpretation means
that the score conveys meaning about the examinee with regards to their standing
among other examinees. A criterion-referenced interpretation means that the
score conveys information about the examinee with regards a specific subject
matter, regardless of other examinees'
scores. [http://www.education.uiowa.edu/itp/itbs/itbs_interp_score.htm Iowa
Testing Programs guide for interpreting test scores]
